snippet: Opponents, including environmental groups, applauded the decision to put an end to the $150 million project, which would have been built on Haverstraw Bay.
abstract: New York State Public Service Commission orders United Water New York, which provides water to most of Rockland County, to drop plans for desalination plant on Hudson River, urging company to explore conservation methods and locate other water sources instead.
lead_paragraph: Opponents, including environmental groups, applauded the decision to put an end to the $150 million project, which would have been built on Haverstraw Bay.

headline.main: Plan for a Desalination Plant Is Halted by New York State Officials
headline.print_headline: Plan for a Desalination Plant Is Halted by State Officials
